intro: Ranunculus djuloeensis, commonly known as the Djuloe buttercup, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of Ethiopia. It belongs to the Ranunculaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, cup-shaped flowers that typically range in color from yellow to white. The plant features palmate leaves with lobed divisions, and it thrives in cool, moist environments. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
